description: The Department of Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada Lacombe Research Centre, Alberta has the requirement for as-and-when requested supply, pick-up, delivery and/or application of various blended fertilizers to fields in the Lacombe, Alberta area.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
**Referencent Numéro:** WS3833508455/Doc3841504285
## Tender Information
**Tender Title:** Blended Fertilizer Supply and Application Services

* **Business Categories:** 10171600 - Chemical Fertilizers and Plant Nutrients
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive Open Bidding
* **Notice Type:** Standing Offer Invitation
* **Contract Value:** Not disclosed
* **Contract Period:** 1st Apr 2023 - 30 Apr 2024 (with option to extend by 3 years)

## Tender Details

* **Submission Deadline:** 2:00 PM EST (March 9, 2023)
* **Contracting Entity:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **End-User Entity:** Department of Agriculture and Agri-Food (AAFC)
* **Regions of Operation:** Lacombe, Alberta
* **Regions of Delivery:** Lacombe, Alberta

## Amendments and Modifications
A correction to the closing time for bid submissions has been made. Please disregard the original response deadline of 2:00 PM EST and instead, submit your bid by this revised date and time.

## Important Documents and Information

* The bid should include all required supporting documentation and a bid submission by the deadline.
* Bids submitted after 2:00 PM EST will be considered non-responsive.
* The contract period includes the option to extend by 3 years.

## Contact Information
For any queries or concerns, please contact:

Diane Warnell
SPAC/PSPC
diane.warnell@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
[WWW](http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/15385726?extsite=MTUzODU3MjZfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==)

## Opening Document

The tender notice and specifications can be accessed on the provided URL.

**Please note:** This is a rewritten version of the provided text with minor adjustments and rephrasing to better clarify the content and adhere to a more professional tone. Any ambiguity, missing, or incorrect information has been assumed to be minor or trivial to convey within the 400-word limit imposed. Further verification of details should be undertaken before proceeding with the tender submission process.
